channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The aurora borealis was visible in much of the U.S. last night due to a solar storm
item.description: We talk with a NOAA scientist about the Northern Lights, and why their visibility seems to be increasing.
item.content:encoded: We talk with a NOAA scientist about the Northern Lights, and why their visibility seems to be increasing.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Australia toughens its gun laws following Bondi Beach terrorist attack
item.description: In the wake of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack last month, Australia toughened its gun laws on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: In the wake of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack last month, Australia toughened its gun laws on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Katie Silver

item.title: Fighting between Syrian Kurds and state forces leaves huge ISIS camp unguarded
item.description: Security at the biggest ISIS detention camp in Syria has collapsed as Syrian Kurds withdraw to face advancing government forces.
item.content:encoded: Security at the biggest ISIS detention camp in Syria has collapsed as Syrian Kurds withdraw to face advancing government forces.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Benin's urban boom comes at a human cost
item.description: In West Africa, tiny Benin is riding a coastal building boom — but beneath the cranes and construction, new inequalities are taking hold.
item.content:encoded: In West Africa, tiny Benin is riding a coastal building boom — but beneath the cranes and construction, new inequalities are taking hold.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Trump speaks at length with reporters before heading off to Davos
item.description: President Trump held court with reporters for more than 90 minutes marking the first year anniversary of his second term.
item.content:encoded: President Trump held court with reporters for more than 90 minutes marking the first year anniversary of his second term.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Americans' views of the U.S. alliance with Europe
item.description: Many Americans agree with President Trump that Europe should pay more for its own defense, but think his attacks on U.S. allies are unwise and will hurt the United States in the end.
item.content:encoded: Many Americans agree with President Trump that Europe should pay more for its own defense, but think his attacks on U.S. allies are unwise and will hurt the United States in the end.
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Wall Street-backed landlords a target for both Trump and Democrats
item.description: Like President Trump, lawmakers around the country blame corporate homebuyers for high prices and want to restrict them. Experts say it's not so simple, and passing laws has proved difficult.
item.content:encoded: Like President Trump, lawmakers around the country blame corporate homebuyers for high prices and want to restrict them. Experts say it's not so simple, and passing laws has proved difficult.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Federal prosecutors subpoena Minnesota officials as immigration crackdown continues
item.description: Dozens of doctors in Minnesota say immigration and enforcement agents have made providing health care in and out of hospitals much more difficult.
item.content:encoded: Dozens of doctors in Minnesota say immigration and enforcement agents have made providing health care in and out of hospitals much more difficult.
item.dc:creator: Matt Sepic

item.title: Transatlantic alliances fray as Trump threatens tariffs regarding Greenland
item.description: Attendees at Davos are steeling themselves for major disruption — not only to the local traffic thanks to heightened security, but possibly to the existing world order.
item.content:encoded: Attendees at Davos are steeling themselves for major disruption — not only to the local traffic thanks to heightened security, but possibly to the existing world order.
item.dc:creator: Mara Liasson

item.title: Women's Hockey is building it and breaking attendance records
item.description: A big crowd is big news for the Professional Women's Hockey League, which is only in its third season.
item.content:encoded: A big crowd is big news for the Professional Women's Hockey League, which is only in its third season.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson
